VIDEO | Anshuli Arya, Secretary, Department of Official Language (Ministry of Home Affairs), made several noteworthy announcements that reflect the evolving approach to language policy in India. She shared that official correspondence from the Centre is now being sent in the languages of respective states—for instance, letters to the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu are sent in Tamil, not just Hindi or English. This move ensures that all Indian languages are treated with respect and seen as integral to the mainstream. Hindi Shabd Sindhu now has 7L words; aims to be world’s finest dictionary by 2029.

#Homeaffairs 

(Full video available on PTI Videos - 
ptivideos.com)
GoI has developed an App BHASHINI which anyone can use to translate from any Indian Language to Another. So if CM TN replies in Tamil she will read it in Hindi.
